newsitem.title: UK: Longbridge climbs to premium on AIM debut.
newsitem.headline: Longbridge climbs to premium on AIM debut.

text.p: Shares in headhunter Longbridge International Plc leapt to a premium on Tuesday on their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM).
Longbridge's shares, issued at 100p, gained 15-1/2p to 115-1/2p by 1400 GMT in light volume.
"There is not much free market trading in this stock," said one dealer.
Longbridge is an international search and selection consultancy specialising in the legal and investment banking professions with offices in London and the English Midlands.
The company, which had a market value of 3.6 million stg at the issue price, raised around 800,000 stg via an Enterprise Investment Scheme offer.

Frank Varela, the company's chairman and managing director, said the proceeds would be used to develop Longbridge's information technology, to aid expansion and may be used for acquisitions of competitors.
Varela said the company had a strong client base in Asia and would like to open an office in Hong Kong.
